member.name: INSTALLSPEC
member.summary: The INSTALLSPEC structure specifies a group policy application by its user-friendly name and group policy GUID or by its file name extension. The Spec member of the structure provides this information to the function.

member.name: INSTALLSPEC.AppName
member.summary: Structure that contains the following members.

member.name: INSTALLSPEC.AppName.Name
member.summary: The user-friendly name of the application as it appears in Add or Remove Programs and the Group Policy Object Editor. You can obtain the name by calling .

member.name: INSTALLSPEC.AppName.GPOId
member.summary: The GUID for the group policy object in which the application exists. You can obtain the group policy object GUID by calling .

summary.para: The file name extension, such as .jpg, of the application to be installed.
summary.div: Note fails if the Type member of equals FILEEXT and there is no application deployed to the user with this file name extension.

member.name: INSTALLSPEC.ProgId
member.summary: This parameter is reserved and should not be used.

member.name: INSTALLSPEC.COMClass
member.summary: This parameter is reserved and should not be used.

member.name: INSTALLSPEC.COMClass.Clsid
member.summary: This parameter is reserved and should not be used.

member.name: INSTALLSPEC.COMClass.ClsCtx
member.summary: This parameter is reserved and should not be used.
